basic_info.description: I am currently a junior in high school, in love with Computer Science, and teaching. I joined AiGoLearning in December of 2020. Currently I am a vice president and responsible for the Tech Team. I started my journey here as a Python teacher, and my love for helping others brought me to a level I could have never imagined! I am forever grateful for the opportunities I had and the poeple I met at AiGoLearning.

projects.title: AiGoCode Bot
projects.description: A Discord interface for aigocode.org, created with Discord.py. This bot allows you to interact with aigocode.org straight from Discord, and includes many more fun functionalities for member engagmenet. This bot serves over 200 people as of April 4, 2022

projects.title: Scheduling Bot
projects.description: After having a conversation with who was responsible for teacher training at AiGoLearning, I noticed there was a dire need to automate scheduling between teachers and evaluations. This Discord bot allows teachers to quickly schedule an evaluation for any course at any time, given the availability of the evaluators in the server. This bot serves 150 users as of April 4, 2022.

projects.title: Independent Class Creation
projects.description: After creating the STAR program, one of the benefits STAR teachers would have is the ability to create their own classes, in their own time. For this, I created a Google Form that would ask the teacher when they were available, what course to teach, and etc. All of this information, after going through a Python script, is then displayed to parents who would like to get their kids in AiGoLearning.

projects.title: Teacher Analyzer
projects.description: After the creation of the STAR program, I thought it would be nice to have a way to assign scores to teachers based on many factors, including leadership skills, organization, student engagement, and course knowledge. This analzyer was created using a Google Form where you could submit the skill level of a teacher. From there, a Python script would analzye the data and write the score to a Google Spreadsheet.

projects.title: STAR Program
projects.description: After being nominated Teaching Quality Officer, and seeing great progress in the teaching skills of many teachers at AiGoLearning, I decided to create the STAR Program. In this program, the best teachers would receive countless benefits.

projects.title: Python Curriculum
projects.description: Noticing a lackluster Python curriculum at AiGoLearning, together with another peer, we created a new 16-hour curriculum for object oriented programming with Python. It includes class outlines, presentations, materials, instructions on how to teach, and extra resources.

experience.title: Vice President
experience.description: I was considered for president, however, understanding the great responsibility I'd have, and knowing I would not be able to reconcile all the aspects of my life, I became vice president. In this position, I am responsible for the tech team and the development of any software for AiGoLearning.

experience.title: Teaching Quality Officer
experience.description: Due to my outsanding performance as a teacher, I was considered for Teaching Quality Officer. In this position I am responsible for improving the overall quality of all teachers, essentially spreading the wisdom I have acquired teaching. I impacted dozens of teachers with workshops, one-on-one meetings, and hopefully, an exponentially larger amount of students. I am also making sure to structure my work so well that whoever replaces me has a structured foundation to continue helping others.

experience.title: Teacher
experience.description: I did not have the best Python teacher during my Sophomore year in highschool, and because of that, most of my classmates depended on me to learn the subject. A friend of mine noticed my passion for teaching, and being a former teacher at AiGoLearning, she invited me to be one too. As of now, I have taught three classes, lead five demo days, and I was selected as teacher of the week my first week here. I recommend visitng my LinkedIn and looking at my featured posts for an interview I did when selected as teacher of the week.
